headline: Microsoft announces quarterly dividend increase
summary: Microsoft Corp. on Monday announced that its board of directors declared a quarterly dividend of $0.91 per share, reflecting an 8 cent or 10% increase over the previous quarter's dividend. The dividend is payable Dec. 11, 2025, to shareholders of record on Nov. 20, 2025. The ex-dividend date will be Nov. 20, 2025.

headline: Alphabet Stock Rallies to a $3 Trillion Market Cap
summary: Google-parent Alphabet continued its September rally on Monday, with the company's market value topping $3 trillion for the first time.  In afternoon trading, shares of the tech giant were up about 3.8%, giving Alphabet a market value of $3.03 trillion, according to Dow Jones Market Data.  Since Sept. 2, the day before the company got a favorable court ruling on a closely watched antitrust case, Alphabet shares have risen 18%.

Since Sept. 2, the day before the company got a favorable court ruling on a closely watched antitrust case, Alphabet shares have risen 18%.

headline: Google Parent Alphabet Just Hit $3 Trillion — Here's What Drove It Higher
summary: Google parent Alphabet (NASDAQ:GOOG) (NASDAQ:GOOGL) hit a $3 trillion market cap on Monday after its stock jumped over 4%, rubbing shoulders with rival Big Tech giants Nvidia (NASDAQ:NVDA), Microsoft (NASDAQ:MSFT), and Apple (NASDAQ:AAPL). U.S. District Judge Amit Mehta‘s lighter-than-expected antitrust ruling, rejecting the United States Department of Justice’s (DOJ) push to force Google to divest its Chrome browser, triggered a stock price rally earlier in September. headline: Canadian AI firm Cohere targets growth in Europe with Paris office
summary: PARIS (Reuters) -Canadian AI startup Cohere is expanding operations in Europe, intensifying competition with homegrown players like France's Mistral to supply AI services in the region.  Cohere, which was valued at $6.8 billion in its latest funding round, opened an office in Paris on Monday and is keen to take a bigger share of Europe's growing demand, said CEO Aidan Gomez.  The firm will join others lured to the French capital by French President Emmanuel Macron's push to create a European AI hub in the country, part of a bid to reinforce Europe's digital sovereignty.

raw.headline: Canadian AI firm Cohere targets growth in Europe with Paris office
raw.summary: PARIS (Reuters) -Canadian AI startup Cohere is expanding operations in Europe, intensifying competition with homegrown players like France's Mistral to supply AI services in the region.  Cohere, which was valued at $6.8 billion in its latest funding round, opened an office in Paris on Monday and is keen to take a bigger share of Europe's growing demand, said CEO Aidan Gomez.  The firm will join others lured to the French capital by French President Emmanuel Macron's push to create a European AI hub in the country, part of a bid to reinforce Europe's digital sovereignty.

headline: Alphabet enters $3 trillion market cap club as Big Tech's AI momentum builds
summary: Google parent Alphabet hit a market capitalization of $3 trillion for the first time on Monday, riding on renewed optimism around artificial intelligence and a favorable antitrust ruling.  Class A shares of the company were up 3.8% at $250, while Class C shares climbed 3.7% to $250.4 - both trading at record highs.  Alphabet joined other tech giants Apple and Microsoft in hitting a $3 trillion valuation, while AI chipmaker Nvidia, the world's most valuable company, boasts a market cap of $4.25 trillion.

raw.headline: Alphabet enters $3 trillion market cap club as Big Tech's AI momentum builds
raw.summary: Google parent Alphabet hit a market capitalization of $3 trillion for the first time on Monday, riding on renewed optimism around artificial intelligence and a favorable antitrust ruling.  Class A shares of the company were up 3.8% at $250, while Class C shares climbed 3.7% to $250.4 - both trading at record highs.  Alphabet joined other tech giants Apple and Microsoft in hitting a $3 trillion valuation, while AI chipmaker Nvidia, the world's most valuable company, boasts a market cap of $4.25 trillion.

headline: Alphabet hits $3 trillion in market capitalization for first time
summary: Class A shares of the company were up 4.6% at $251.88, while Class C shares climbed 4.5% to $252.3 - both trading at record highs.  Alphabet joined companies including iPhone maker Apple and Microsoft that have also clinched valuations of $3 trillion.  The latest boost for the Google-parent was a ruling by a U.S. federal judge that allowed the company to retain control of its Chrome browser and Android mobile operating system, marking a pivotal moment for the tech giant whose dominance in search and mobile ecosystems has long drawn scrutiny.

raw.headline: Alphabet hits $3 trillion in market capitalization for first time
raw.summary: Class A shares of the company were up 4.6% at $251.88, while Class C shares climbed 4.5% to $252.3 - both trading at record highs.  Alphabet joined companies including iPhone maker Apple and Microsoft that have also clinched valuations of $3 trillion.  The latest boost for the Google-parent was a ruling by a U.S. federal judge that allowed the company to retain control of its Chrome browser and Android mobile operating system, marking a pivotal moment for the tech giant whose dominance in search and mobile ecosystems has long drawn scrutiny.

headline: Fable enters next chapter: Toan Dinh appointed CEO, Alwar Pillai named Executive Chair
summary: Fable, the leading platform for building inclusive digital products, today announced that Toan Dinh has been appointed Chief Executive Officer (CEO), effective September 1, 2025.  This leadership transition marks a significant milestone in Fable's journey and reflects the company's deliberate approach to long-term succession planning and growth.  Since 2018, Fable has partnered with leading global organizations, including Microsoft, Salesforce, Walmart, CVS, Visa, and Spotify, to help them design and deliver digital experiences that work for everyone ensuring billions of people worldwide can engage with technology without barriers.
